details.title: Decline in COVID-19 positivity rate despite increasing tests exponentially: Centre
details.content: The testing for the disease has been increased from 363 tests per million per day on August 1 to more than 600 tests per million per day at present, Bhushan said, with India having tested nearly 3.7 crore cumulative COVID-19 samples so far. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Mores tests conducted daily
details.content: India has exponentially scaled its testing from one in January to 10 lakhs/day in August 2020. With Positivity Rate progressively falling, testing has worked as an effective tool to limit the spread of COVID-19 infection: Ministry of Health, Government of India.

details.title: Diamond industry feels COVID heat
details.content:
Diamond polishing industry of India has suffered a blow due to COVID. Compared to last year, the exports have gone down by US$ 3000 Million. The demand for Indian diamond has not gone down but everything was closed across the world, so there was no business: Dinesh Navadiya https://t.co/aDruHp2zvZ

details.title: Patients from outside, reopening of economy behind rise in COVID-19 cases in Delhi: Experts
details.content: Co-incidentally, the number of examinations for the detection of COVID-19 conducted on the days the capital recorded cases less than 1,000 were below the average 20,000 tests being conducted daily, according to data. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Kejriwal calls for meeting amid high number of cases in national capital
details.content: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal (in file pic) has called for a meeting today over the increase in number of COVID-19 cases. Delhi Health Minister and other officials to attend the meeting.

Kerala: In wake of advisory not to purchase imported flowers during Onam celebrations, children in Kuttiady, Kozhikode search for flowers in their neighbourhood to make Pookkalam (floral decoration).

details.title: Plasma therapy: Docs await ICMR trial results as confusion grows
details.content: Many doctors say the lack of a clear scientific signal, coupled with the tedious process of procuring plasma even as the expectations of patients and their relatives are high once they receive it, make the choice of therapy difficult. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WATCH | COVID19 Impact: Global tourism lost USD 320 Billion in five months
COVID-19: Manohar Khattar, Shibu Soren to be treated at same Gurugram hospital
details.content: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar and former Jharkhand CM Shibu Soren, both found infected with Covid-19, will be treated at the same hospital as the Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) president was being shifted to Gurugram’s Medanta on Tuesday, a day after the BJP leader was admitted to the same the hospital. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: WATCH | Tamil Nadu: Tribal students climb a hill to access internet for online classes
Uttarakhand CM tests negative
details.content:
• Uttarakhand Chief Minister Trivendra Singh Rawat has isolated himself for three days as a precautionary measure despite his novel coronavirus test report coming negative.
  • Sharing this information on the social media on Tuesday, Rawat said he and his family underwent a COVID-19 test along with the staff and the security personnel at the CMO as a precautionary measure.
  • "With the grace of God and your blessings the report is negative. However, as a precaution, I will remain in isolation for the next three days and discharge my duties from my residence telephonically or by using virtual platforms," he tweeted.
  • The chief minister chose to undergo a coronavirus test after an officer on special duty tested positive for the infection recently.

details.title: More updates from Delhi
details.content:
• Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has called a high-level meeting to discuss the rising number of novel coronavirus cases in Delhi, sources said on Wednesday.
  • Health Minister Satyendar Jain, Chief Secretary Vijay Dev and senior officials will attend the meeting, which will take place at 11 am, according to sources.
  • The city recorded 1,544 more COVID-19 cases and 17 deaths on Tuesday. It was the first time in over a month that the number of new infections crossed the 1,500 mark.

details.title: Andhra Pradesh: Senior Congress leader kills self after contracting COVID-19
details.content: The senior leader, aged 55, was the vice-president of Kadapa district Pradesh Congress Committee and hails from Chilamkuru in Errakuntla mandal. details.title: Ex-Assam CM and Congress leader Tarun Gogoi tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: Gogoi, who represents the Titabor assembly constituency in Jorhat district, is the 13th Assam legislator to be diagnosed with COVID-19. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Update on Union Minister Shripad Naik's health
details.content: Health condition of Union Minister Shripad Naik has improved with all his vital parameters within limits. He tested COVID-19 positive on RTPCR test conducted by GMC on Tuesday. Test to be repeated after 24-48 hours: Dr Shekhar Salkar, Manipal Hospital, Goa.

details.title: Negligible cornea retrievals, shortfall in donations: Eye banking system among worst-hit non-emergency medical activities in lockdown
details.content: Union Health Minister Harsh Vardhan, who addressed the 35th National Eye Donation fortnight celebrations and presided over the interactive webinar organised by AIIMS, Delhi and the National Eye Bank, reiterated the advice of the medical community that "it is highly unlikely for the virus to be transmitted via donor corneas", a health ministry statement said. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Phase II human trial of Oxford COVID-19 vaccine begins in Pune
details.content: The Phase II clinical trial of the Oxford COVID-19 vaccine, being manufactured by the city-based Serum Institute of India (SII), began at a medical college and hospital here on Wednesday. Two male volunteers were administered the vaccine at Bharti Vidyapeeth's Medical College and Hospital, a senior office-bearer of the hospital said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Phase II human trial of Oxford COVID-19 vaccine begins in Pune
details.content: The Phase II clinical trial of the Oxford COVID-19 vaccine, being manufactured by the city-based Serum Institute of India (SII), began at a medical college and hospital here on Wednesday. Two male volunteers were administered the vaccine at Bharti Vidyapeeth's Medical College and Hospital, a senior office-bearer of the hospital said. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Major updates of the day
details.content:
•  Former Assam CM Tarun Gogoi tests positive, asks people, who came in contact with him during the last few days, to immediately get themselves tested.
  • Union Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan inaugurated two new Medical Colleges at Bharatpur & Bhilwara, Rajasthan & also Superspeciality Blocks in Govt Medical Colleges at Udaipur, Bikaner & Kota, via video conferencing.
  • Recovery rate is more than 90% in the national capital, there has been an increase in cases in the last few days, number of tests will be doubled in coming days: Delhi CM Kejriwal
  • Health condition of Union Minister for AYUSH Shripad Naik admitted to Manipal Hospital for last 14 days is better. A team of doctors from AIIMS, Delhi visited him again & said he's not required to be shifted to AIIMS, Delhi: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
  • Bihar reports 2163 new cases, state tally rises to 21,814
  • Himachal tally rises to 5206

details.title: To contain COVID-19, Chennai's Koyambedu market may have its own odd-even formula
details.content:
It is learnt that traders are working on various solutions to contain the spread of the virus including opening of shops on alternate days. An association leader said this could help to ease congestion in the market. He said the traders committee will also monitor the opening of shops and the arrival of vehicles. A log book will also be maintained.

details.title: SP Balasubrahmanyam conscious and responsive, but still on ventilator, ECMO support: Hospital
details.content: In an evening medical bulletin, the private hospital where the singer is being treated has said that SPB continues to be in the ICU on ventilator and ECMO support. His current clinical condition is stable. He is conscious and responsive.

details.title: With 12 new COVID-19 cases,Dharavi's tally rises to 2,737: BMC
details.content: For the second day in row, Dharavi slum colony on Wednesday reported 12 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total count to 2,737, a Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) official said. With 2,380 of the total 2,737 patients already recovered from the infection, the slum sprawl is now left with only 97 active cases, he said.

details.title: Only 2% of the 1.4 lakh who attended fever camps in Chennai's Ambattur zone had ILI symptoms
details.content: In the Ambattur zone of the city corporation, only 2% of those who attended fever camps between May 8 and August 25 were found to have ILI (Influenza Like Illnesses) symptoms. Of the 1.4 lakh people who attended fever camps during this period, only 2438 were found to have symptoms.(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:
Maharashtra Cabinet has decided to exempt tax for commercial and goods vehicles in the state from 1st April to 30th September. The decision has been taken in view of losses incurred by the commercial vehicles and goods carriers, due to COVID19 pandemic: Chief Minister's Office

details.title: Kin switch to firewood as electric crematorium shut down

details.title: 23 Punjab MLAs test positive ahead of Assembly session
details.content: Twenty-three MLAs in Punjab have tested positive for the novel coronavirus so far. The development comes just two days before the beginning of the monsoon session of the Assembly. details.title: Pregnant women avoid checkups to avoid exposure to virus risk, may add complications
details.content: Doctors have found that pregnant women are not making frequent visits to hospitals for antenatal care and regular screenings, due to the fear of contracting Covid-19. This may lead to complications and put lives of both the mother and child in danger, doctors warned.

details.title: Oxford COVID-19 vaccine on track? Vital health parameters of volunteers normal, says medical official
details.content: Vital health parameters of the two volunteers, who have been administered the Oxford COVID-19 vaccine candidate at a medical college in Pune as part of the phase II clinical trial, are normal, says senior official from the medical facility.

details.title: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Krishan Pal Gurjar  tests positive for virus
details.content:
स्वास्थ्य संबंधी दिक्कतों को गंभीरता से लेते हुए मैंने कोरोना टेस्ट करवाया जिसकी रिपोर्ट पॉजिटिव आई है। चिकित्सकों के परामर्श पर अब इलाज चलेगा। जितने भी लोग पिछले दिनों मेरे संपर्क में आएं हैं, कृपया वह कोरोना को गंभीरता से लेते हुए अपना कोरोना टेस्ट करवा लें।

— Krishan Pal Gurjar (@KPGBJP) August 27, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 can affect almost all organs, symptoms maybe unrelated to lungs: Experts
details.content: Experts from AIIMS stressed that classification of cases into mild, moderate and severe categories based just on respiratory symptoms should be relooked to include other organ involvement.

मुझे रात हल्का बुखार था मैंने स्वयम COVID का टेस्ट करवाया जिसकी रिपोर्ट Positive आयी है। मेरा उन लोगों से अनुरोध है जो इन दिनों मेरे संपर्क में थे कि वह सुरक्षा की दृष्टि से अपनी जांच करवा लें।

details.title: Ex-President Pranab Mukherjee still in deep coma, ventilator support: Hospital
details.content: Former President Pranab Mukherjee continues to be in a deep coma and on ventilator support, the hospital where he is admitted said on Thursday. According to the doctors treating 84-year-old Mukherjee, he is haemodynamically stable. Doctors say a patient is haemodynamically stable when the blood circulation parameters - blood pressure, heart and pulse rate, are stable and normal.

details.title: Carbon emissions down due to COVID lockdown: Ministry
details.content: Due to the COVID-19 lockdown across India, this year's carbon emissions are predicted to fall by around eight per cent: senior environment ministry official.

details.title: Four undertrial prisoners, undergoing treatment for coronavirus, escape from Hyderabad's Gandhi Hospital
details.content:
Four prisoner undergoing treatment for Covid-19 at the Gandhi Hospital in #Hyderabad, escaped from the hospital in the wee hours of Thursday.

The prisoners were from the Chanchalguda and Cherlapally prisons.

Efforts are still underway by the police to trace and nab them.

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) August 27, 2020

details.title: 385 new COVID-19 cases in Tripura push tally to 9,927
details.content: At least 385 people tested positive for COVID-19 in Tripura on Thursday, pushing the state's tally to 9,927, a health department official said. The death toll rose to 85 with two more persons succumbing to the infection, he said. A total of 123 people were discharged from Agartala Government Medical College (AGMC) on Wednesday, following their recovery.

details.title: COVID situation in UP
details.content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directs officials to maintain special vigil in the four districts of Lucknow, Kanpur Nagar, Gorakhpur and Shahjahanpur and further strengthen the medical facilities there in view of the COVID-19 situation.

details.title: NEET, JEE exams during COVID
details.content: NTA DG told me that 7.5 lakhs out of 8.58 lakhs candidates in JEE have downloaded admit cards. For NEET, over 10 lakhs out of 15.97 lakhs candidates downloaded admit cards in 24 hrs. It shows that students want that exams are held at any cost: Education Minister Ramesh Pokhriyal

details.title: Nagaland reports 6 new cases
details.content: Six new COVID19 cases, 124 recoveries reported in Nagaland today. Recovered patients shall be kept under surveillance: S Pangnyu Phom, Minister for Health & Family Welfare, Govt of Nagaland

details.title: COVID impact on GST collection
details.content: GST collection has been severely impacted this year, due to COVID19 pandemic. As per GST Compensation Law, states need to be given compensation: Finance Secretary on 41st meeting of GST Council

details.title: Koyambedu wholesale market to reopen in phases from September starting with vegetable trade
details.content: Sources said the temporary market in Thirumazhisai, which was allocated to 240 wholesale traders, would be shut immediately after the vegetable wholesale traders move into the Koyambedu market.

details.title: Koyambedu wholesale market to reopen in phases from September starting with vegetable trade

details.title: Hospital in Uttarakhand closed after pharmacist tests positive for COVID
details.content: The District Hospital, Pithoragarh was closed for two days on Thursday after a pharmacist working at the facility tested positive for COVID-19. "We have closed the hospital for two days as a precautionary measure. The pharmacist tested positive on Wednesday evening," Chief Medical Officer, Pithoragarh, Harish Pant said. However, the emergency ward of the hospital will remain operational with doctors attending to patients telephonically, he said.

details.title: HCL offers support to Chennai zoo, Crocodile Bank as visitors dry up amid COVID-19 pandemic

details.title: Vande Bharat Mission phase 6 to begin on September 1

details.title: 32 areas of Puducherry to go under 'localised lockdown' from August 31 to contain COVID-19
details.content: In the wake of the surge in COVID-19 cases, there has been an immediate exigency to enforce a cluster containment strategy and localised lockdown to contain the disease within a defined geographic area by early detection of cases, breaking the chain of transmission and thus preventing its spread to new areas.

details.title: JIPMER, private medical colleges asked to ramp up beds for COVID-19 patients in Puducherry
details.content:
District Collector cum District Magistrate T Arun has directed JIPMER to dedicate 700 beds for severe COVID-19 cases. Five private medical colleges have also been directed to allot 300 beds each for treating COVID-19 patients. The ramping up will lead to a total bed strength of 3150 in the Puducherry region.

FULL REPORT HERE

details.title: Five-day lockdown imposed in J-K's Samba to check spread of coronavirus
details.content: The lockdown from August 28 to September 1 midnight was ordered by Samba District Magistrate Rohit Khajuria, officials said. Quoting an order issued by Khajuria, the officials said the step was taken in view of the spurt in COVID-19 cases.

details.title: SC to decide on conduct of final year exams tomorrow
details.content: Supreme Court to pronounce tomorrow its verdict on a batch of petitions challenging University Grants Commission's July 6 circular and seeking cancellation of final term examination in view of COVID-19 situation.

details.content: Flagging that 89% of the Covid-19 deaths have been reported in the country from 10 states over the last two weeks, the Centre on Thursday asked these states to take immediate steps to cut down the mortalities due to the infectious disease. (READ MORE)

details.title: Coronavirus hits isolated Great Andamanese tribe, 10 infected
details.content: Ten members of India's dwindling Great Andamanese tribe have tested positive for coronavirus, officials said Thursday, fuelling concerns about the safety of the group and other indigenous people in the remote archipelago. (READ MORE)

details.title: Mizoram holds rural, local body polls amid Covid-19
details.content: Despite the Covid-19 pandemic, Mizoram held elections to village councils and local councils on Thursday but by maintaining the Covid-19 protocol, including social distancing. (READ MORE)

details.title: Attempts to reach herd immunity naturally dangerous: WHO
details.content: At least two-thirds of a population needs to develop the immunity for it to matter, and that, in turn, needs the vaccine to happen safely and effectively, the health official said. (READ MORE)
